Reviews.Title: “The place to stay in Otay.”
Reviews.Author: John F
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in this hotel several times while doing business in Mexico. It is the cleanest and nicest hotel close to the border. Rooms are very large with a separate area with a couch and desk. Breakfast is well made and the staff is very friendly and accommodating. The location is right off the freeway and within five minutes drive of the border crossing at Otay Mesa. Only drawback is lack of restaurants other than fast food. Price of rooms is on low end of other hotels in area.

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel. Consistently good every time. Excellent for family trips to San Diego.”
Reviews.Author: Toolmantym
Reviews.Content: We have been staying at this hotel 2 or 3 times a year for the past 6 years, and every time it is great. Of course don't expect 5 star luxury, it is comfort suites after all. But the rooms are a good size, enough room for my family of 6. Always clean and well maintained. Good sized swimming pool and jacuzzi. Friendly staff, and a pretty good Free breakfast. Which Is a lifesaver with Teanage kids. Location wise, it's a little bit out of the way I your wanting downtown San Diego, or mission bay. But weighing up value / distance, it's well worth the trek. And the reality is, it's only 15-20 mins from downtown and maybe 30 mins from sea world. Overall a great value family stay. Highly recommended...

Reviews.Title: “Not so great!”
Reviews.Author: lovebug123
Reviews.Content: After being in the travel business for a long time, I have had the opportunity to stay in MANY hotels. Everything from the Ritz to Motel 6. I know what people look for in a hotel. My family and I were looking for clearn, affordable and safe while we visited my dad in South San Diego. We knew we would not spend time at the hotel, so we decided to not spend too much money but wanted something clean and decent. This hotel had good customer service. The lady at the front desk was friendly and helpful. The bed was comfortable. The breakfast was decent. That is about the extent of the positive. Now for the real problems: Our kitchenette sink was clogged when we arrived. The room smelled bad. The furniture and carpet was dingy. The manager who came into my room to unclog the sink, left a 12 inch knife ( very sharp) right on the bathroom sink area that my two year old found and handed to me!!!! This was that straw that broke the camels back and mine! I was shocked. His reaction? "oh. I forgot the knife" oooops! Then, I called down for a roll a way bed since the couch was so smelly and dirty for my three year old and he said, "sure no problem". I only found out later that he would charge me for this without informing me of the price or the fact that there was a charge in the first place. His explanation? " this is not a cheap motel maam" Only cheap hotels don't charge for roll a way beds. What? made no sense to me at all. When I saw the knife, I should have just grabbed my family and ran for the hills. The location stinks too! You are surrounded by industrial toxins and huge trucks in line to cross the border. It is way out of the way from anything remotely interesting....( except for Mexico) if you you happen to have your passport with you. The only reason I gave this hotel any credit at all was their nice front desk lady and the comfy bed in the room. Other than that, this hotel is AWFUL!!!

Reviews.Title: “Clean and convenient, but thin walls!”
Reviews.Author: Professional_Fan
Reviews.Content: We stayed here because we were attending a show at the Cricket Wireless Amphitheater; none of my party drive and we needed a hotel close by. The room was large and clean but smelt old, like it hadn't been aired for years. The beds were very comfy though, and the smell definitely wasn't a reflection on the cleaniness of the room itself. The staff were really friendly, although the woman on the front desk gave us some embarrassing advice regarding a nearby restaurant: she told us it was too far to walk with our luggage (four 'long' blocks) and called us a cab; turns out it was literally around the corner and resulted in a very annoyed cab driver (who'd taken the job after his colleague didn't bother showing up at all) and us over-tipping in embarrassment. The only other complaint we had was that the walls in our room were extremely thin. We could hear people snoring in the next suite along! But overall it was great value for the price (approx. $95) and perfect for attending the concert (about 10 miles in a cab).

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Customer Service: Every Time”
Reviews.Author: DrFrisbie
Reviews.Content: If you want a warm welcome after a long day of traveling, arrive at this Comfort Suites, near the border of Mexico in San Diego's South County. We return to this hotel on a regular basis. Suites are clean and comfortable, breakfast is an expanded (deluxe) continental. The property has a fitness center and outdoor pool, and a computer with internet access in the lobby. Free wireless internet is available throughout the hotel and works well. We return here for one primary reason: Exceptional customer service! We've stayed here dozens of times, sometimes arriving on short notice or no notice at all. Without exception all of our stays here have been pleasant and encouraging. The staff really goes out of their way to be welcoming and positive. We love staying here! Many thanks to the management and staff of this clean, beautiful property. As we say each time we check out here, "We'll be back!"

Reviews.Title: “Could not have been happier”
Reviews.Author: gbthecoach
Reviews.Content: OK the other reviews say it all. This is not near downtown San Diego. If you want to walk there it is not going to happen (hence my 4 star and not 5 for location). That said I did not need to get there and had some business in the south east area of San Diego. This is the most friendly Comfort Suites I have stayed at. The gentleman checking me in was very friendly. Very talkative though checking me in and really seemed to care that everything was OK with my stay. He even gave me two bottles of water. I had never been to Tijuana and since it was just 4PM and I have nothing to do that night I asked him for directions and advice. He had lived there and gave me some great places to eat and directions on where to park and walk across the border. Fantastic first impression. When I got back the bed was very comfortable. Great pillow top in this hotel. I hate lousy hotel beds and when spending under $100 for a hotel/motel you dont expect the best but this was the best bed I had been on in a hotel (and I spend 30 nights per year on average in them) The rooms had a fridge and were spotless. I know where I am staying next time I am in town. Next morning I enjoyed their breakfast and found my renal car had battery problems. There were 3 people working there in the morning and after calling Budget (and getting a 2 hour quote on time) I asked the front desk if he could help. He did have cables at the front desk and had me on my way in under 3 minutes. It is easy to find faults when you travel and at times I do. I wrote this because when a property vastly exceeds your expectations they deserve praise. I wish I remembered the name of who checked me in but this guy should train every hotel worker. I was amazed at how friendly all the staff was, how clean my room was. It was nice and large with a great bed. What more could one ask for about $70 in San Diego. I am coming back for sure. THANK YOU COMFORT SUITES OTAY MESA FANTASTIC STAY.

Reviews.Title: “a good place to stay in south bay of san diego”
Reviews.Author: jackcheese
Reviews.Content: My family stayed here for a couple of days last weekend. They have excellent hot breakfast every day with a lot of choice, clean room with extra space, good service and nice staff. The location is right on the border and kind of away from downtown. IHOP, Subway and McDonald are near by.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for the value”
Reviews.Author: argonauts52
Reviews.Content: Hotel was $60 for the night as we were going to Mexico the next day. Hotel is right next to the border. Rooms were very big and clean. Great staff. The location is kind of lousy because there is not much around in terms of restaurants or things to do. Not really the hotel's fault, but something to keep in mind. Great place for the price to spend the night if you were going to Mexico for a day.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SNAFU23
Reviews.Content: I recently had business near the border and stay at this hotel. The hotel was a great value for the price, and I would stay here again. The hotel is located in an industrial area, so there is not really anything to do within walking distance. There is an AM/PM service station, and I think a restaurant, but that's pretty much it. The Hotel is very clean and the service is excellent. They have a pool and jacuzzi, which looked very clean. The rooms are large, clean, and nicely decorated. The room also has a separate seating area and a desk. They each have a refrigerator and microwave, but not safe, which would have been nice. The free breakfest was nice, with a decent variety of breakfast foods to choose from. The eating area does get a little crowded but you can always take the food to your room. If I was in the area for business, I would definately stay here again. WARNING - The exit is the last before crossing into the Mexico, pay attention to the exit signs.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms - great! Location - not so much.”
Reviews.Author: County-Hunter
Reviews.Content: If this place wasn't located in an industrial area a stone's throw from where all commercial truck traffic passes across the border, we'd be nominating it for a spot of the top 10 motel list. The rooms were spacious and the staff was attentive and helpful. The breakfast was good although as one poster commented, it gets crowded so I wouldn't wait to about 10 to 9 to try and get your breakfast unless you don't mind waiting 15 minutes to get to the waffle maker. There aren't many dining options in the area other than fast food, but it was late when we got in (almost 9) and we called up Bambino's Italian restaurant to see if they were open and the owner decided to stay open for me and my family. He welcomed us to his restaurant and we had an excellent meal. I wouldn't recommend walking across the border here. We decided to avoid Tijuana thinking we might find it easier to shop here. Well, there is almost no shopping to speak of. When you finally walk to the main drag, it is lined with auto part stores and other non-descript offices. We did find a little mini-mart where we bought a liter of vanilla and a small pharmacy. That was about it, although the people were friendly and willing to help. Downtown San Diego is about 25-30 minutes away so if you don't mind driving in and parking and spending the day there, you can save yourself some money and hassle from downtown by staying here.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: tomcat33333
Reviews.Content: This is a terrific hotel with value prices. Because it is located a stone's throw from the Mexican border -- away from beaches and tourist areas -- it fights hard to win your business. It does so with -- Attentive staff, particulary Juan at the front desk; -- Very clean, comfortable rooms with comfortable beds; -- A breakfast that includes fruit, hot waffles, a hot meat or egg dish, cereal and pastry -- Very nice pool and spa area, with the most effective spa we've ever been in. We paid $83 a night over Labor Day. if you know San Diego, you know you are not going to get that kind of rate on a decent property in an area closer to downtown during a holiday weekend. The drive was well worth it, because we could get to Coronado Beach within 25 minutes or so. The hotel is located in an industrial area which includes a couple of small malls. There's at least one local Italian restaurant located nearby, but it's not exactly gourmet, so you'll probably plan on eating a bit farther away. Negatives? the breakfast room is much too small to handle a full house. Other than that, we think it's great. We're going back in a couple of weeks, and we'll pay $11 a night less for the same quality.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Macawluver
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay very much. The price was reasonable. The beds are super comfortable and the room was very clean. The breakfast was delicious as well, especially the waffles. The only drawback is that the hotel is located in an industrial area without very many restaurants. Also, it is a pretty good distance from many of the San Diego attractions. We would definitely stay here again though.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort Suites trully is Comfort!”
Reviews.Author: darkcardcaptor
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Comfort Suites because of their low rates, but was astounded when I arrived. The rooms are bigger than average and they are clean. We originally stayed on the 1st floor but asked to be moved to 2nd floor. Yes the location is far from Sea World and other attractions but you cant beat the price and the excellence of the hotel. They have a huge breakfast that has a Waflle bar and various juices and milks. Also the hotel staff is so very, very accomodating. We had so many difficult requests and they were able to grant them all. We needed directions to places and so forth. On our 1st night there we arrived into town, and the front desk agent, Phelipe was there. He checked us in and looked up restaurants that had live entertainment and even called the restaurant and made reservations. He told us how to get to Ensenada for some Whale watching. Amazing service. Housekeepers and all. I would reccomend this place to everyone. The only drawback is that there is no security on weekends....

Reviews.Title: “Inexpensive, clean and fine if you have a car”
Reviews.Author: pjbarry
Reviews.Content: We booked here when we were looking for an inexpensive (relatively) place to stay for our long weekend in San Diego. Nothing we could find that was closer was any cheaper and most of those places didn't have the best reviews. I'm glad we booked here. Yes, it's close to the border; yes, it's 22+ miles to the Gaslamp District, SeaWorld and the zoo and 27 miles to La Jolla. But if you have a car, it's an easy drive (we had NO traffic issues at all -- maybe a fluke because of the holiday) and the reward is a clean room that seems to have been recently updated. The beds were firm (and appeared to be new), the sheets were clean and actually fit the beds (amazed at how many places use flat sheets in place of fitted these days -- at least in the less expensive chains). The comforter looked like a real comforter and they even had a bed skirt. They clearly post signs (on the bed and in the bathroom) saying they are trying to conserve water/resources and only change linens every 3 days (unless you request otherwise). I think they had just steam cleaned the carpets, too -- our carpet was slightly damp and smelled of floral cleaner the first night, but fine by the morning after we ran the AC overnight. We had no problems with any of the staff (all were courteous, smiling and willing to help when we had questions) and there were signs of them constantly trying to maintain things while we were there (we saw pool cleaners, they were painting the entry driveway and saw cleaning and breakfast staff all the time). The only thing I can think that wasn't way above average was the TV -- the signal was bad, but we weren't there to watch TV, so we didn't even mention it till we left (so they could possibly fix it before another guest stayed in the room). So... all in all, we were extremely pleased with our stay and would stay there again in a heartbeat. In terms of "budget" hotel experiences, this was definitely the best one in years (if not the best, overall). And we paid $81/night for the holiday weekend -- booked directly through their website. Very impressed.

Reviews.Title: “Right on the border”
Reviews.Author: dcree
Reviews.Content: I booked this reservation for my husband and son, because my son had a baseball tournament in the San Diego area. My husband said that he was not exagerating when he said you could throw something out the window and it would land in Mexico. Not that this was an issue, however my husband complained that there was not much like restaurants, etc. near the hotel and it took a minimum of a half hour to get to anything. The continental breakfast was descent. They had trouble with housekeeping. One day they had to call and ask for someone to clean their room. Another day they had to call for towels. They staff at the front desk was unresponsive, especially when my 17 year old son was trying to get help. Though they had some of the best rates in the San Diego area, I don't think I would book rooms there again. The location seems to be far from every place my husband and son wanted to be and the service was not that great.

Reviews.Title: “Finally a place to rest”
Reviews.Author: Nilo14
Reviews.Content: Nice an clean hotel with a great value. The 30 minutes to San Diego or the beach didn t matter to us,since the place was quite and we had a great sleep there. The night we went to Imperial Beach and a had a great diner. For travelling to Mexico, this is a bargain and a great value. We travel a lot and have miserable experience with Motel 8, and finaly found a chain which offers great and comforable service.Try this one out, even you visit Seaworl or other places. The 30 minutes drive to all attractions are nothing, compared to the rest you and the children will get there.

Reviews.Title: “if you don't mind driving!!!”
Reviews.Author: travellover72
Reviews.Content: The property is nice and clean. Rooms are nice and spacious. Microwave and Refridgerator were nice to have - due to lack of open food choices. Although I would only recommend for short stays, as everything in the area closes early. Hard to find anything that is open late for dinner or fast food, even the Mcdonalds that is 2mins away closes by 11pm. I did have good sense of security considering that it is in a dark industrial area. Hotel is well lit at nite. If you are planning to see San Diego alot this is not the hotel for you. Drive to downtown is 30-40 min. Spend the extra money on city hotel as you will end up spending more money on gas anyway. If you are planning Mexico visits this is the perfect location.

Reviews.Title: “Good Breakfast, however, . . .”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The breakfast was the best part of this hotel. In our room, the bedspread was stained and the carpet was very dirty. I had to wash my feet after walking around on it. The location is good if you are going to Mexico. It takes some time to go to San Diego because of border traffic. But the breakfast was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Really great little hotel - excellent value!”
Reviews.Author: LA_Larry2
Reviews.Content: This is a great little hotel! Really GREAT value - clean, comfortable and quiet and great deluxe continental breakfast. Particularly good if you want a nice comfortable place to stay overnight on your way to Tijuana (TJ) or places further South. It's about a 10 minute walk to the Otay Mesa border crossing, which is so much lower stress and quicker than the much more heavily used San Ysidro crossing. We checked out in the morning, left our car in the parking lot (which management was happy to let us do), walked across the border, and grabbed a cab to where we needed to go in TJ. Coming back to the U.S. later that day, it was a very quick walk through inspection at the border, nothing like San Ysidro. I do agree with prior review that it is a little far out from the main part of San Diego, so you would probably be disappointed if you really want to stay right in the heart of San Diego, but I like this hotel so much that I would consider staying here even if my primary destination were San Diego instead of TJ.

Reviews.Title: “Too far”
Reviews.Author: Stella
Reviews.Content: Nothing wrong with the hotel except for one important thing - location. Unless your destination is Mexico, I will not recommend this hotel for touring San Diego. You do get a nice view of the bordering Mexico, especially at night, but going to the central touristy spots in San Diego is a good 20 minute drive, that is if you are not stuck in the border crossing traffic. Basically the hotel is located one exit from the border. There's nothing much surrounding it except for 1 IHOP, some gas stations, 1 MacDonald, 1 Jack in the Box. It's about 8 miles from the nearest highway. The room is a basic suite, with a queen bed and a separate sitting area. The bed is one of the hardest I have slept on, but it is clean. There is a mini fridge and a microwave. Breakfast is complimentary and is similar to other chains like Residence Inn. They had make it yourself pancakes, biscuits and sausage gravy, bagels, cereal, etc. There is a reason why the rate is so cheap...

HotelInfo.Name: Comfort Suites Otay Mesa
HotelInfo.Address: 2351 Otay Center Ct., San Diego, CA 92154-7614
